roleset.name: get, capture

example.name: quasi-agentive
example.text: The employees also said the project may have been snagged by budgetary concerns.

example.name: locative instrument
example.text: But the effort became snagged on the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance.
example.arg: on the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance.

example.name: different kind of instrument
example.text: The deficit-reduction bill became snagged over efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference.
example.arg: over efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG0
example.text: The employees also said the project may have been snagged by budgetary concerns .

roleset.note: SNAG-V NOTES: Based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from snag.01-v)
